item.title: Kim add a quote by S. M. Stirling
item.description: "There is a technical term for someone who confuses the opinions of a character in a book with those of the author. That term is idiot." -- S. M. Stirling

item.title: Kim add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "A mind needs books as a sword needs a whetstone, if it is to keep its edge." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Kim add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "Bran thought about it. 'Can a man still be brave if he's afraid?' 'That is the only time a man can be brave,' his father told him." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Kim add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "It is one thing to be clever and another to be wise." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Kim add a quote by Diana Gabaldon
item.description: "I stood still, vision blurring, and in that moment, I heard my heart break. It was a small, clean sound, like the snapping of a flower's stem." -- Diana Gabaldon

item.title: Kim add a quote by Diana Gabaldon
item.description: "When the day shall come that we do part," he said softly, and turned to look at me, "if my last words are not 'I love you'-ye'll ken it was because I didna have time." -- Diana Gabaldon

item.title: Kim add a quote by Diana Gabaldon
Kim add a quote by Diana Gabaldon
item.description: "Oh, aye, Sassenach. I am your master . . . and you're mine. Seems I canna possess your soul without losing my own." -- Diana Gabaldon

item.title: Kim add a quote by Diana Gabaldon
item.description: "I prayed all the way up that hill yesterday, he said softly. Not for you to stay; I didna think that would be right. I prayed I'd be strong enough to send ye away. He shook his head, still gazing up the hill, a faraway look in his eyes. I said 'Lord, if I've never had courage in my life before, let me have it now. Let me be brave enough not to fall on my knees and beg her to stay.' He pulled his eyes away from the cottage and smiled briefly at me. Hardest thing I ever did, Sassenach." -- Diana Gabaldon

item.title: Kim add a quote by Diana Gabaldon
item.description: "You are my courage, as I am your conscience," he whispered. "You are my heart---and I your compassion. We are neither of us whole, alone. Do ye not know that, Sassenach?" -- Diana Gabaldon

item.title: Kim add a quote by Diana Gabaldon
item.description: "Murtagh was right about women. Sassenach, I risked my life for ye, committing theft, arson, assault, and murder into the bargain. In return for which ye call me names, insult my manhood, kick me in the ballocks and claw my face. Then I beat you half to death and tell ye all the most humiliating things have ever happened to me, and ye say ye love me." He laid his head on his knees and laughed some more. Finally he rose and held out a hand to me, wiping his eyes with the other. "You're no verra sensible, Sassenach, but I like ye fine. Let's go." -- Diana Gabaldon

item.title: Kim add a quote by Diana Gabaldon
item.description: "Blood of my Blood," he whispered, "and bone of my bone. You carry me within ye, Claire, and ye canna leave me now, no matter what happens, You are mine, always, if ye will it or no, if ye want me or nay. Mine, and I wilna let ye go." -- Diana Gabaldon

item.title: Kim add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Folks are usually about as happy as they make their minds up to be." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Kim add a quote by Tom Bodett
item.description: "They say a person needs just three things to be truly happy in this world: someone to love, something to do, and something to hope for." -- Tom Bodett

item.title: Kim add a quote by E.M. Forster
item.description: "God has put us on earth to love our neighbors and to show it, and He is omnipresent, even in India, to see how we are succeeding." -- E.M. Forster

item.title: Kim add a quote by E.M. Forster
item.description: "Life never gives us what we want at the moment that we consider appropriate." -- E.M. Forster
